p:
As of Aug 2, 2019, 2468 laboratory-confirmed cases of MERS, with 851 deaths (34·5% mortality) had been reported to WHO since September, 2012, globally.
2 2090 (84%) of these cases occurred in Saudi Arabia and the largest outbreak outside of Saudi Arabia occurred in South Korea in May, 2015, with 186 cases and 36 deaths reported.
2 The number of cases in Saudi Arabia and Oman has recently increased, with 126 cases reported in January–March, 2019, compared with 189 cases reported from July, 2017, to June, 2018.
2 Discovered in 2012, MERS-CoV continues to circulate in the Middle East and remains a threat to global health security. Despite many WHO scoping reviews and stakeholder meetings defining urgent priority research needs, major knowledge gaps in the epidemiology, transmission, pathogenesis, and evolution of MERS-CoV remain. 1, 3
